methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates a new Symbol manager.

params.name: handle
params.comment: the database handler

params.name: addrMap
params.comment: the address map.

params.name: openMode
params.comment: the open mode.

params.name: lock
params.comment: the program synchronization lock

params.name: monitor
params.comment: the progress monitor used when upgrading.

throws.comment: if the user cancels the upgrade.
if a database io error occurs.
if the database version doesn't match the current version.

methods.name: findVariableStorageAddress
methods.comment: Find previously defined variable storage address

params.name: storage
params.comment: variable storage

return.comment: previously defined variable storage address or null if not found

methods.javadoc:
Check for and upgrade old namespace symbol addresses which included a namespace ID.
 Start at end since Namespace-0 will not result in an OldGenericNamespaceAddress.
 Namespace-0 external symbols do not need to be upgraded since this is effectively
 where all the moved external addresses will be placed.
 The triggering of this upgrade relies on the addition of the VariableManager which
 trigger an upgrade.
@param monitor
methods.name: upgradeOldNamespaceAddresses
methods.comment:
Check for and upgrade old namespace symbol addresses which included a namespace ID.
 Start at end since Namespace-0 will not result in an OldGenericNamespaceAddress.
 Namespace-0 external symbols do not need to be upgraded since this is effectively
 where all the moved external addresses will be placed.
 The triggering of this upgrade relies on the addition of the VariableManager which
 trigger an upgrade.

methods.name: processOldVariableAddresses
methods.comment:
Upgrade old stack and register variable symbol address to variable addresses.
 Also force associated references to be updated to new variable addresses.

methods.name: migrateFromOldVariableStorageManager
methods.comment:
No more sharing the same variable address for multiple variable symbols.
 Must split these up.  Only reference to variable addresses should be the
 symbol address - reference refer to physical/stack addresses, and symbolIDs.

methods.javadoc: Create mem references for the external entry points; then delete the table.
methods.name: processOldExternalEntryPoints
methods.comment: Create mem references for the external entry points; then delete the table.

methods.name: processOldLocalSymbols
methods.comment: Add old local symbols

methods.name: saveLocalSymbol
methods.comment:
Save off old local symbols whose upgrade needs to be deferred until after function manager
 upgrade has been completed.

params.name: tmpHandle
params.comment: scratch pad database handle

params.name: symbolID
params.comment: local symbol ID

params.name: oldAddr
params.comment: old address value from symbol table

params.name: name
params.comment: symbol name

params.name: isPrimary
params.comment: true if symbol is primary at oldAddr

methods.javadoc:
Convert the specified dynamic symbol to a named symbol. Both symbol removed and symbol added
 notifications are performed, although the symbol instance is changed and continues to be
 valid.
methods.name: convertDynamicSymbol
methods.comment:
Convert the specified dynamic symbol to a named symbol. Both symbol removed and symbol added
 notifications are performed, although the symbol instance is changed and continues to be
 valid.

methods.name: doRemoveSymbol
methods.comment: Removes the symbol directly

params.name: sym
params.comment: the symbol to remove.

return.comment: true if the symbol was removed, false otherwise.

methods.name: getSymbol
methods.comment: Gets the symbol with the given info.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the symbol

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address of the symbol

params.name: parentID
params.comment: the id of the namespace symbol that the symbol belongs to.

methods.name: searchSymbolsByNamespaceFirst
methods.comment:
Returns the list of symbols with the given name and namespace.

 This method works by examining all symbols in the given namespace for those with
 the specified name.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the symbols in include.

params.name: namespace
params.comment: the namespace of the symbols to include.

return.comment: the list of symbols with the given name and namespace.

methods.name: getMaxSymbolAddress
methods.comment: Returns the maximum symbol address within the specified address space.

params.name: space
params.comment: address space

return.comment: maximum symbol address within space or null if none are found.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the next available external symbol address
@return
methods.name: getNextExternalSymbolAddress
methods.comment: Returns the next available external symbol address

methods.name: moveSymbolsAt
methods.comment:
Move symbol.  Only symbol address is changed.
 References must be moved separately.

methods.name: namespaceRemoved
methods.comment:
Called by the NamespaceManager when a namespace is removed; remove all symbols that have the
 given namespace ID.

params.name: namespaceID
params.comment: ID of namespace being removed

methods.name: createVariableSymbol
methods.comment:
Creates variable symbols. Note this is not a method defined in the Symbol Table interface.
 It is intended to be used by Ghidra program internals.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the variable

params.name: namespace
params.comment: the function that contains the variable.

params.name: type
params.comment: the type of the variable (can only be PARAMETER or LOCAL_VAR)

params.name: firstUseOffsetOrOrdinal
params.comment: the offset in the function where the variable is first used.

params.name: storage
params.comment: the VariableStorage (stack, registers, etc.)

params.name: source
params.comment: the symbol source type (user defined, analysis, etc.)

throws.comment: if there is another variable in this function with that name.
if the name contains illegal characters (space for example)

return.comment: the new VariableSymbol that was created.

methods.name: createSpecialSymbol
methods.comment:
Creates a symbol, specifying all information for the record.  This method is not on the
 public interface and is only intended for program API internal use.  The user of this
 method must carefully provided exactly the information needed depending on the type of symbol
 being created.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address for the symbol

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the symbol

params.name: parent
params.comment: the namespace for the symbol

params.name: symbolType
params.comment: the type of the symbol

params.name: data1
params.comment: long value whose meaning depends on the symbol type.

params.name: data2
params.comment: int value whose meaning depends on the symbol type.

params.name: data3
params.comment: string value whose meaning depends on the symbol type.

params.name: source
params.comment: the SourceType for the new symbol

throws.comment:
if the symbol type must be unique and another already has that name
 	       in the given namespace.
if the name contains any illegal characters (i.e. space)

methods.name: createCodeSymbol
methods.comment: Internal method for creating label symbols.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address for the new symbol

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the new symbol

params.name: namespace
params.comment: the namespace for the new symbol

params.name: source
params.comment: the SourceType of the new symbol

params.name: data3
params.comment: special use depending on the symbol type and whether or not it is external

throws.comment: if the name contains illegal characters (i.e. space)

methods.name: createFunctionSymbol
methods.comment: Internal method for creating funcions symbols.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address for the new symbol

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the new symbol

params.name: namespace
params.comment: the namespace for the new symbol

params.name: source
params.comment: the SourceType of the new symbol

params.name: data3
params.comment: special use depending on the symbol type and whether or not it is external.

throws.comment: if the name contains illegal characters (i.e. space)

methods.javadoc:
If the new symbol is Default, returns the primary symbol if it is dynamic.  Otherwise
 returns any Code symbol with the same name and namespace.
methods.name: findSymbolToPromote
methods.comment:
If the new symbol is Default, returns the primary symbol if it is dynamic.  Otherwise
 returns any Code symbol with the same name and namespace.
